rescuecore2.misc

Class WorkerThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • rescuecore2.misc.WorkerThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class WorkerThread
extends java.lang.Thread
    Abstract class for threads that need to repeat a unit of work, for example listening on a socket and dispatching data to listeners.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

        java.lang.Thread.State, java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class java.lang.Thread

      Construct a worker thread.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorkerThread

        public WorkerThread()
        Construct a worker thread.

    • Method Detail

      • kill

        public void kill()
          throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Interrupt any current work, tell the thread to stop and wait for the thread to die.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the thread that called kill is itself interrupted.

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Find out if this thread is still running. If kill() has been called (and returned) or if work() has returned false then this worker thread is not still running.
        Returns:
        True if it is still running and has not been killed, false otherwise.

      • work

        protected abstract boolean work()
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Do a unit of work and return whether there is more work to be done. Implementations should check periodically for interruptions and throw an exception when required.
        Returns:
        True if more work remains, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the worker thread is interrupted.

      • setup

        protected void setup()
        Perform any setup necessary before work begins. Default implementation does nothing.

      • cleanup

        protected void cleanup()
        Perform any cleanup necessary after work finishes. This will be called even if the work() method throws an exception. It is highly recommended that this method does not throw any exceptions. Default implementation does nothing.
